page.title: 08A FARM VISIT IN WINTER
page.content: This is how{Jenny Pegg,}a five year old pupil described a farm visit.Jenny recently moved to the area from Lincolnshire. On the last day of February we went to Tan Llan. First we went to the cowshed where we saw one cow that had just calved. Then we went into a barn and we stood in a cubicle and watched Mr Jones clean the barn using the tractor.The cattle were outside eating silage but at night they have hay.Miss Eirian showed us the silage ,it smelt like toffee and it was damp.She then led us into a sort of shed and showed us what the calves ate. After that we went into a little cowshed and stroked a calf. As we walked back to school we could see the young lambs playing in the field.We also saw the geese but the goslings have not hatched yet.
